# v1.1.0 Issue Pack - Ready to Create

Copy-paste ready issues for v1.1.0 milestone.

## Issue 1: Promote multiagent new to GA

**Title**: `[v1.1] Promote multiagent new from preview to GA`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `feature`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Promote `multiagent new` command from preview to General Availability (GA).

## Current Status

- Preview implementation exists in `scripts/multiagent_new.py`
- CLI entry point: `multiagent-new` (via pyproject.toml)
- Basic scaffold generation works

## Goals

- [ ] Add `multiagent` CLI entry point (main command)
- [ ] Promote to stable API
- [ ] Add templates:
  - [ ] `static-site` - Static website generator
  - [ ] `api-service` - REST API service (FastAPI)
  - [ ] `etl-pipeline` - ETL pipeline template
- [ ] Add flags:
  - [ ] `--preset` - Use preset configuration
  - [ ] `--with-ci` - Include CI/CD setup
  - [ ] `--with-docs` - Include documentation setup
  - [ ] `--with-examples` - Include example pipelines
- [ ] Update documentation
- [ ] Add tests

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] `multiagent new` command works as main entry point
- [ ] All templates generate valid projects
- [ ] Flags work correctly
- [ ] Documentation complete
- [ ] Tests pass

## Related

- See `docs/V1.1_ROADMAP.md` for full roadmap
```

---

## Issue 2: Pipelines Gallery

**Title**: `[v1.1] Create Pipelines Gallery with 5 Reference Examples`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `gallery`, `documentation`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Create a Pipelines Gallery showcasing 5 complete, production-ready pipeline examples.

## Gallery Pipelines

1. **Static Site Generator** - Generate static website from markdown
2. **REST API Service** - FastAPI service with OpenAPI docs
3. **ETL Pipeline** - Data extraction, transformation, loading
4. **CLI Tool** - Command-line utility
5. **Microservice** - Microservice with Docker

## Requirements

- [ ] Create `pipeline/gallery/` directory
- [ ] Each pipeline includes:
  - [ ] `pipeline.yaml` - Complete working pipeline
  - [ ] `README.md` - Description, usage, screenshots
  - [ ] `pipeline.dot` - Graph visualization
  - [ ] `pipeline.png` - Rendered graph
  - [ ] Sample execution report
- [ ] Gallery index page (`pipeline/gallery/README.md`)
- [ ] "Run this" one-command examples
- [ ] Link from main README

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All 5 pipelines work end-to-end
- [ ] Documentation complete
- [ ] Visual assets included
- [ ] Gallery accessible from main README

## Related

- See `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/v1.1-pipelines-gallery.md` for detailed spec
```

---

## Issue 3: Plugin API Tests

**Title**: `[v1.1] Add External Test Plugin for CI Validation`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `plugin-api`, `test`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Create external test plugin repository and integrate into CI to validate Plugin API.

## Requirements

- [ ] Create separate repository: `test-plugin-multiagent`
- [ ] Implement minimal test plugin (see `docs/TEST_PLUGIN_SPEC.md`)
- [ ] Add CI workflow to test plugin loading
- [ ] Integrate into main framework CI (`.github/workflows/plugin-api-test.yml` exists)
- [ ] Add to PR checks
- [ ] Document in contributing guide

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Test plugin repository exists
- [ ] CI validates plugin loading automatically
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] Documentation complete

## Related

- See `docs/TEST_PLUGIN_SPEC.md` for specification
- See `.github/workflows/plugin-api-test.yml` for CI workflow
```

---

## Issue 4: PyPI Publishing

**Title**: `[v1.1] Publish to PyPI`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `pypi`, `release`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Publish package to PyPI for easy installation via `pip install`.

## Prerequisites

- [ ] Entry points finalized
- [ ] CLI entry point (`multiagent`) complete
- [ ] Long description from README added
- [ ] Classifiers added (Python versions, topics)

## Tasks

- [ ] Test PyPI upload (TestPyPI first)
- [ ] Configure `PYPI_TOKEN` secret
- [ ] Verify workflow (`.github/workflows/publish-pypi.yml` exists)
- [ ] Publish to PyPI
- [ ] Verify installation: `pip install multi-agent-system`
- [ ] Update documentation with installation instructions

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Package installable via `pip install multi-agent-system`
- [ ] Entry points work correctly
- [ ] CLI command available: `multiagent`
- [ ] Documentation updated

## Related

- See `docs/BUILD_WHEELS.md` for build instructions
- See `.github/workflows/publish-pypi.yml` for workflow
```

---

## Issue 5: Artifact Retention Policy v2

**Title**: `[v1.1] Enhanced Artifact Retention Policy`

**Labels**: `enhancement`, `v1.1`, `feature`

**Body**:
```markdown
## Overview

Enhance artifact retention with TTL/Quota per category and per run-owner.

## Current Status

- Basic retention exists (`scripts/clean_artifacts.py`)
- Simple TTL and size-based cleanup

## Requirements

- [ ] TTL/Quota per category (requirements/codegen/docs)
- [ ] Per run-owner policies
- [ ] "What-if" simulation mode
- [ ] Better reporting and metrics
- [ ] Integration with retention weekly job

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Category-based retention works
- [ ] Per-owner policies implemented
- [ ] Simulation mode available
- [ ] Reports generated
- [ ] Tests pass

## Related

- See `scripts/clean_artifacts.py` for current implementation
```

---

## How to Create Issues

1. Go to: `https://github.com/<owner>/<repo>/issues/new`
2. Copy title and body from each issue above
3. Add labels
4. Assign to milestone: `v1.1.0`
5. Create issue

## Milestone Setup

Create milestone `v1.1.0`:
- Title: `v1.1.0`
- Description: `See docs/V1.1_ROADMAP.md`
- Due date: Set target date
